Sample rows respecting quantiles of a reference distribution

sample_quantile_matched_rows.Rd

This function randomly samples rows from a data frame in such a way that the quantiles of the selected data match as closely as possible those of the full data.

Usage

sample_quantile_matched_rows(
  data_frame,
  reference,
  sample_fraction,
  num_quantiles = 10,
  seed = 60427,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

data_frame

A data frame from which to sample rows.

reference

A numeric vector of the same length as the number of rows in the data frame.

sample_fraction

A fraction specifying the proportion of rows to sample from the data frame.

num_quantiles

An integer specifying the number of quantiles, default is 10.

seed

An integer specifying the random seed to use.

verbose

A logical specifying whether to print messages.

Value

A data frame of sampled rows.

Examples

sampled <- sample_quantile_matched_rows(mtcars, mtcars$mpg, sample_fraction = 0.1)
#> ✔ Sampled 3 rows from the data frame.
plot(quantile(mtcars$mpg), quantile(sampled$mpg))
abline(0, 1)
